title: Boca Raton, Florida
summary: Boca Raton (/rəˈtoʊn/ rə-TOHN;[9][10] Spanish: Boca Ratón, [ˈboka raˈton]), is a city in southern Palm Beach County, Florida. It was first incorporated on August 2, 1924,[11] as "Bocaratone,"[12] and then incorporated as "Boca Raton" in 1925. The 2019 population estimated by the U.S. Census Bureau was 99,805.[13] However, approximately 200,000 additional people with a Boca Raton postal address live outside of municipal boundaries,[14] such as in West Boca Raton. As a business center, the city experiences significant daytime population increases. Boca Raton is 45 miles (72 km) north of Miami and is a principal city of the Miami metropolitan area, which had a population of 6,012,331 people as of 2015. It is known as one of the wealthiest places in South Florida.[15][16][17][18]
